segment.source: Build a device selector
segment.target: Build a device selector

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: ** Important APIs **
segment.target: ** Important APIs **

segment.source: Windows.Devices.Enumeration
segment.target: Windows.Devices.Enumeration

segment.source: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.
segment.target: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.

segment.source: This will enable you to only get relevant results and will also improve the performance of the system.
segment.target: This will enable you to only get relevant results and will also improve the performance of the system.

segment.source: In most scenarios you get a device selector from a device stack.
segment.target: In most scenarios you get a device selector from a device stack.

segment.source: For example, you might use GetDeviceSelector for devices discovered over USB.
segment.target: For example, you might use GetDeviceSelector for devices discovered over USB.

segment.source: These device selectors return an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string.
segment.target: These device selectors return an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string.

segment.source: If you are not familiar with the AQS format, you can read more at Using Advanced Query Syntax Programmatically.
segment.target: If you are not familiar with the AQS format, you can read more at Using Advanced Query Syntax Programmatically.

segment.source: Building the filter string
segment.target: Building the filter string

segment.source: There are some cases where you need to enumerate devices and a provided device selector is not available for your scenario.
segment.target: There are some cases where you need to enumerate devices and a provided device selector is not available for your scenario.

segment.source: A device selector is an AQS filter string that contains the following information.
segment.target: A device selector is an AQS filter string that contains the following information.

segment.source: Before creating a filter string, you need to know some key pieces of information about the devices you want to enumerate.
segment.target: Before creating a filter string, you need to know some key pieces of information about the devices you want to enumerate.

segment.source: The DeviceInformationKind of the devices you are interested in.
segment.target: The DeviceInformationKind of the devices you are interested in.

segment.source: For more information about how DeviceInformationKind impacts enumerating devices, see Enumerate devices.
segment.target: For more information about how DeviceInformationKind impacts enumerating devices, see Enumerate devices.

segment.source: How to build an AQS filter string, which is explained in this topic.
segment.target: How to build an AQS filter string, which is explained in this topic.

segment.source: The properties you are interested in.
segment.target: The properties you are interested in.

segment.source: The available properties will depend upon the DeviceInformationKind.
segment.target: The available properties will depend upon the DeviceInformationKind.

segment.source: See Device information properties for more information.
segment.target: See Device information properties for more information.

segment.source: The protocols you are querying over.
segment.target: The protocols you are querying over.

segment.source: This is only needed if you are searching for devices over a wireless or wired network.
segment.target: This is only needed if you are searching for devices over a wireless or wired network.

segment.source: For more information about doing this, see Enumerate devices over a network.
segment.target: For more information about doing this, see Enumerate devices over a network.

segment.source: When using the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs, you frequently combine the device selector with the device kind that you are interested in.
segment.target: When using the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs, you frequently combine the device selector with the device kind that you are interested in.

segment.source: The available list of device kinds is defined by the DeviceInformationKind enumeration.
segment.target: The available list of device kinds is defined by the DeviceInformationKind enumeration.

segment.source: This combination of factors helps you to limit the devices that are available to the ones that you are interested in.
segment.target: This combination of factors helps you to limit the devices that are available to the ones that you are interested in.

segment.source: If you do not specify the DeviceInformationKind, or the method you are using does not provide a DeviceInformationKind parameter, the default kind is DeviceInterface.
segment.target: If you do not specify the DeviceInformationKind, or the method you are using does not provide a DeviceInformationKind parameter, the default kind is DeviceInterface.

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs use canonical AQS syntax, but not all of the operators are supported.
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs use canonical AQS syntax, but not all of the operators are supported.

segment.source: For a list of properties that are available when you are constructing your filter string, see Device information properties.
segment.target: For a list of properties that are available when you are constructing your filter string, see Device information properties.

segment.source: Caution Custom properties that are defined using the format cannot be used when constructing your AQS filter string.
segment.target: Caution Custom properties that are defined using the format cannot be used when constructing your AQS filter string.

segment.source: This is because the property type is derived from the well-known property name.
segment.target: This is because the property type is derived from the well-known property name.

segment.source: The following table lists the AQS operators and what types of parameters they support.
segment.target: The following table lists the AQS operators and what types of parameters they support.

segment.source: Operator
segment.target: Operator

segment.source: Supported types
segment.target: Supported types

segment.source: COP\_EQUAL
segment.target: COP\_EQUAL

segment.source: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_NOTEQUAL
segment.target: COP\_NOTEQUAL

segment.source: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_LESSTHAN
segment.target: COP\_LESSTHAN

segment.source: UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_GREATERTHAN
segment.target: COP\_GREATERTHAN

segment.source: UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_LESSTHANOREQUAL
segment.target: COP\_LESSTHANOREQUAL

segment.source: UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_GREATERTHANOREQUAL
segment.target: COP\_GREATERTHANOREQUAL

segment.source: UInt16, UInt32
segment.target: UInt16, UInt32

segment.source: COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS
segment.target: COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS

segment.source: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array
segment.target: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array

segment.source: COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS
segment.target: COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS

segment.source: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array
segment.target: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array

segment.source: COP\_VALUE\_STARTSWITH
segment.target: COP\_VALUE\_STARTSWITH

segment.source: String
segment.target: String

segment.source: COP\_VALUE\_ENDSWITH
segment.target: COP\_VALUE\_ENDSWITH

segment.source: String
segment.target: String

segment.source: COP\_DOSWILDCARDS
segment.target: COP\_DOSWILDCARDS

segment.source: Not supported
segment.target: Not supported

segment.source: COP\_WORD\_EQUAL
segment.target: COP\_WORD\_EQUAL

segment.source: Not supported
segment.target: Not supported

segment.source: COP\_WORD\_STARTSWITH
segment.target: COP\_WORD\_STARTSWITH

segment.source: Not supported
segment.target: Not supported

segment.source: COP\_APPLICATION\_SPECIFIC
segment.target: COP\_APPLICATION\_SPECIFIC

segment.source: Not supported
segment.target: Not supported

segment.source: Tip You can specify NULL for COP\_EQUAL or COP\_NOTEQUAL.
segment.target: Tip You can specify NULL for COP\_EQUAL or COP\_NOTEQUAL.

segment.source: This translates to a property with no value, or that the value does not exist.
segment.target: This translates to a property with no value, or that the value does not exist.

segment.source: In AQS, you specify NULL by using empty brackets \[\].
segment.target: In AQS, you specify NULL by using empty brackets \[\].

segment.source: Important When using the COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS and COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS operators, they behave differently with strings and string arrays.
segment.target: Important When using the COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS and COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS operators, they behave differently with strings and string arrays.

segment.source: In the case of a string, the system will perform a case-insensitive search to see if the device contains the indicated string as a substring.
segment.target: In the case of a string, the system will perform a case-insensitive search to see if the device contains the indicated string as a substring.

segment.source: In the case of a string array, substrings are not searched.
segment.target: In the case of a string array, substrings are not searched.

segment.source: With the string array, the array is searched to see if it contains the entire specified string.
segment.target: With the string array, the array is searched to see if it contains the entire specified string.

segment.source: It is not possible to search a string array to see if the elements in the array contain a substring.
segment.target: It is not possible to search a string array to see if the elements in the array contain a substring.

segment.source: If you cannot create a single AQS filter string that will scope your results appropriately, you can filter your results after you receive them.
segment.target: If you cannot create a single AQS filter string that will scope your results appropriately, you can filter your results after you receive them.

segment.source: However, if you choose to do this, we recommend limiting the results from your initial AQS filter string as much as possible when you provide it to the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs.
segment.target: However, if you choose to do this, we recommend limiting the results from your initial AQS filter string as much as possible when you provide it to the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs.

segment.source: This will help improve the performance of your application.
segment.target: This will help improve the performance of your application.

segment.source: AQS string examples
segment.target: AQS string examples

segment.source: The following examples demonstrate how the AQS syntax can be used to limit the devices you want to enumerate.
segment.target: The following examples demonstrate how the AQS syntax can be used to limit the devices you want to enumerate.

segment.source: All of these filter strings are paired up with a DeviceInformationKind to create a complete filter.
segment.target: All of these filter strings are paired up with a DeviceInformationKind to create a complete filter.

segment.source: If no kind is specified, remember that the default kind is DeviceInterface.
segment.target: If no kind is specified, remember that the default kind is DeviceInterface.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceInterface, it enumerates all objects that contain the Audio Capture interface class and that are currently enabled.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceInterface, it enumerates all objects that contain the Audio Capture interface class and that are currently enabled.

segment.source: = translates to COP\_EQUALS.
segment.target: = translates to COP\_EQUALS.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that have at least one hardware id of GenCdRom.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that have at least one hardware id of GenCdRom.

segment.source: ~~ translates to COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS.
segment.target: ~~ translates to COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceContainer, it enumerates all objects that have a model name containing the substring Microsoft.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceContainer, it enumerates all objects that have a model name containing the substring Microsoft.

segment.source: ~~ translates to COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS.
segment.target: ~~ translates to COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceInterface, it enumerates all objects that have a name starting with the substring Microsoft.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of DeviceInterface, it enumerates all objects that have a name starting with the substring Microsoft.

segment.source: ~< translates to COP\_STARTSWITH.
segment.target: ~< translates to COP\_STARTSWITH.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that have a System.Devices.IpAddress property set.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that have a System.Devices.IpAddress property set.

segment.source: <>\[\] translates to COP\_NOTEQUALS combined with a NULL value.
segment.target: <>\[\] translates to COP\_NOTEQUALS combined with a NULL value.

segment.source: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that do not have a System.Devices.IpAddress property set.
segment.target: When this filter is paired with a DeviceInformationKind of Device, it enumerates all objects that do not have a System.Devices.IpAddress property set.

segment.source: =\[\] translates to COP\_EQUALS combined with a NULL value.
segment.target: =\[\] translates to COP\_EQUALS combined with a NULL value.
